sense.name: (cause to) disperse from a single point of origin; distribute over an area
sense.examples: When the Almighty scattered the kings, it was snowing in Zalmon. They scattered the Israelites among the nations. The sudden noise scattered the birds. A cyclone scattered the blockading fleet. I have scattered the seeds of the future. Ethan scattered the fridge magnets all over the floor this evening. Blue and Violet are scattered the most in the atmosphere. The seeds scattered on the bronze statue.
